website_summaries.verdict: Sleek, useful, and affordable. This backpack makes room for all the necessities at a low price.
pros: Great price point for such a well designed and feature-rich bag
Plenty of interior space for multiple cameras, devices, and accessories
The chest-latch allows for additional carrying support
cons: It would be nice if the bag was slightly more durable and offered a bit more security when wearing on your back

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after 2 days of use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one to leave bad reviews or reviews in general but felt it's necessary here. Bought this backpack to store my camera in and within 2 days of use the strap ripped and started to come undone. If you're looking for a quality bag for your expensive gear I'd recommend something else.
customer_reviews.author: nick manchen

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY.... CEHAP Zippers, Ruined $3k Laptop... YOU WILL BE SORRY!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for his June 11 birthday for Film School college. He used it once on trip after birthday, then never again until last week to take his camera and laptop for his fist week of college for the very first day he took camera & laptop to his Film Class. Zipper for laptop area ripped open and laptop fell out and damaged laptop. TERRIBLE... ruined new Mac Pro Laptop of $2,900. Bag Warrant only 30 days from purchase date in May. now it is 9/1 and We are of the bag and $3k laptop.. DO NOT BUY.. You will be VERY SORRY!!!!!!!! Terrible product for Very valuable items DON'T BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MTaylor

customer_reviews.title: Let down by the material quality.
customer_reviews.text: I generally don't write reviews for products, but I figured I'd make an exception for this one. A little more than 3 weeks into making this my daily commuter bag it began to fall apart at the strap. I generally only carry my wallet, Nintendo Switch and my DSLR with 50mm on it for my commute into work so I never really load it up with a lot of heavy gear. I really enjoy the size and the amount of storage, but I think the quality of the bag itself is pretty poor.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: POOR MANUFACTURING.
customer_reviews.text: This is a FABULOUS design and I had high hopes for it. But after TWO uses, the stitching pulled away from the fabric leaving the interior padding exposed in the top pocket. When I contacted Amazon and the third party seller to return it. Disappointed because I loved the design. I guess you get what you pay for. I should have gone to a camera shop and looked at the quality before buying something this important. And you know what else I loved? It had a rain cover. Sheesh
customer_reviews.author: E. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Love this bag! Super Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bag for a couple days now and wow this bag is amazing! Doesn't feel too big but has sooo much space and it's super comfy! Currently, I was able to fit this list into the main part of the bag: Canon Camera with a 50mm 2 Sigma Lenses DJI Mavic Pro inside a hardshell case DJI Mavic Contoller inside a hardshell case 2 extra Mavic Batteries That't not including all the extra accessories I was able to fit in the other compartments!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Media

customer_reviews.title: Totally fell apart during first trip :(
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my boyfriend. He loved it at first. The storage and padding is great. But this bag totally came apart on our first trip! The zippers came open randomly, almost causing loss of items. Luckily, he noticed before anything fell out. I should note, this wasn't some rugged backpacking trip - this was a vacation to Hawaii. I will update with pictures when I can take them. DO NOT BUY THIS BAG!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: On shoulder camera access, Keep Laptop and Camera both on me thru Airline travel
customer_reviews.text: Great general purpose camera bag. Combined 3 important features: side access to camera under the shoulder, adequate space for medium and larger lenses, a dedicated slot to store a laptop. Our biggest lens dragged in and out of a similar but smaller Lowepro Slingshot Edge 250 AW. The camera and attached lens space is larger, allowing easier in/out, and giving me room when I buy the next bigger/longer lens. The laptop pocket makes this wonderful as an airline travel strategy. I can keep my laptop and camera both on me, even if my roll-on gets gate checked. Tripod attach is better than the other two bags I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J

customer_reviews.title: Great back for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great back for the price. Understand the pricing is cheap, but the quality is not bad at all. The only downfall is a couple of the outside pockets bring super small. I have my D3400, 3 lens (50mm, 18-55mm and 70-300mm) as well as a rain cover, tripod, batters, SD cards and other accessories all fit and I have room still for a couple flash kits and more. Not sure I like the straps for "backpack" carrying, however, it has a nice handle on top so I got it more of a duffel style to begin with so it works. Just needed a bigger bags for press shoots and other photo shoots.
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I wonder why this is highly rated. Decent material but the stiches kept coming off. Very uncomfortable to carry as the straps were straining the shoulders even with just one full frame and a couple of medium sized lenses to carry. Even worse and causing more strain if I use a laptop that's just 14" and less than 3.5 lbs. Silly design to keep the rain cover pouch "inside" the backpack. Usually that pouch is underneath the backpack or in a side outer pocket. This basically leaves us with opening the backpack top compartment when it's already raining to pull the cover out and use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but quite big!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, to start with this baby is big. It accomplishes what was needed which is to have access to the lower compartment to store a CPAP machine for quick retrieval at airport security. I also need to store a Laptop, an iPad, mouse, battery pack and a bunch of cables. And the CPAP power supply is a monster too. I do like the strap in back that can slide over my rolling carry-on suitcase. The downside is that due to it's height, it takes almost all of the legroom in coach, even in Plus seating. I'm looking for another one now to fit the bill but a little smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Pen

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this bag probably once a week for the past 3 months. I was expecting this bag to be really durable, but I was sadly mistaken. Close to the bottom of the bag, the stitching is becoming undone and the bag is falling apart. I can't trust this bag with thousands of dollars of equipment if it will fall apart so easily. In terms of space in the bag, the removable sections are a great touch and i can fit my canon 80d and 3 lenses plus a couple of flashes. The top portion could be a tad more spacious, but in general, its good.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: Big on the outside, small on the inside
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a smaller camera backpack, but turned out it has less useful room inside than my 6" smaller backpack. Biggest drawback is lack of enough pockets: one tiny pocket for memory cards, and one small, tight pocket for maybe lens cover? Even a battery is a tight fit. That's it. There is big compartment at the top, where I'm supposed to throw in everything else, which defies the purpose of organizing stuff in a backpack. Plenty of dividers for lenses, but camera space is way too big, camera floats freely inside.
customer_reviews.author: Pen_Name

customer_reviews.title: My everyday camera bag
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this bag for over a year. I carry my mac book, and two full frame cameras daily. Not counting the top pocket which I stuff it with external hard drive and just junk. I'm looking for another just so I can have more organization rather than just stuffing the top pocket. I had to leave a review because I'm having a hard time choosing because of some bad reviews with the other backpacks. Some backpacks might come defective, however not all of them. This is a decent backpack considering I use like I'm a real photographer but use it it like a work bag to take pics and get footage of a gym I own.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Well made and has plenty of room.
customer_reviews.text: This bag has plenty of room for my gear. I have two camera bodies, multiple lenses, all the batteries, chargers, cables, SD cards and more packed in it. I really like the side zipper, makes grabbing one camera quicker. I don't have to set down the bag on its back, open the main compartment, get the camera, re-zip the back, pick it back up .... just unzip, grab and shoot. I am going to Yellowstone Park and wanted a bag that I could carry easily and have ready access, I am hoping this bag does the trick. I will update my review on performance after the trip.
customer_reviews.author: sandy beaches

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my old CaseLogic bag
customer_reviews.text: So, I had a small CaseLogic bag that I loved for years. But now with my GoPros (2), my Canon 80D, 2 lenses and a Mavic Air... I needed more room. This bag is KILLER for the price. Easy draw slot form my DSLR is on the side which took soem getting used to but I like it now. The customizable compartments are great. I can also fit in my cables, chargers, laptop, tablet, headphones, microtripod and a few other items without being hard to zip up! Then it slides right under an airplane seat with no crushing. The handles and straps are strong. Totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hydrazi

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase overall
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice upgrade to my shoulder strap camera bag. It is comfortable and stores all my gear. If i go with a larger telescopic lens I am not sure if it will fit the pack so i gave storage capacity a 4 out of 5 starts. With that said it meets my needs at this time. I do not believe the bag is rain resistant and don't remember if it came with a rain cover. This is not a deal killer for me. I can use a plastic bag to waterproof my gear inside the bag and its also safer that way.
customer_reviews.author: L. E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Finally I've got a big boys' bag!
customer_reviews.text: Now, that my collection of lenses and filters got large enough, I finally pulled the trigger on a bag. Was not disappointed at all! Plenty of storage; the dividers are well made and easily adjustable; a lot of small pockets; a bunch of small compartments. Very comfortable to wear - the harness is good enough to climb Everest! And the side door to pull the camera out is an amazing bonus!!! Whoever thought of this feature deserves a bonus! Or a self pat on a shoulder!
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: good for traveling
customer_reviews.text: i got this to use for when i went to France. it is a great buy for a backpack that can hold your camera and its accessories. however, the backpack seems a bit smaller than it is once you put all of your stuff in it. that may just be me since i am a very organized person that can efficiently store all of the needed/wanted camera accessories and more without any trouble. as it is the backpack has all of the compartments that you will need for storing your stuff in it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag
customer_reviews.text: As a photographer, I struggled with my old camera bag when I needed quick access to my DSLR. This bag is fantastic! Durable, two ways to get to my camera, and worked great while carrying other items in place of a purse while on vacation abroad. My only complaint would be the spot where my tripod was supposed to be secured wasn't quite large enough to accommodate it. You'd probably need to carry a much thinner one.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi Girl

customer_reviews.title: I Little Small
customer_reviews.text: I'm running a Canon M50 with 3 lenses, 2 mics, LED light, battery chargers, USB battery, etc. While I like this I think it is a tad too small. If it were 1/4 larger it would be perfect for all my gear. at this point I'm thinking of buying a different pack. They back zipper pocked for the laptop is nice but behind that is a velcro big back area but the bottom opens up. What the heck is that for? I will it was one big pocket or multiple zippered pockets. Almost but no go.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Hell

customer_reviews.title: Nice overall camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Used this bag for a trip... while the fact that it has space for a tablet as well as most of my equipment as a item you are carrying on to a plane it would have been nice if it had a little more storage space in the top compartment. Having said this I did not actually buy it for that and it did as described Just something I know I will want on future trips The easy access to your camera worked but be careful as he dividers to close the area completely so you loose a little bit storage. Overall worked like a champ and I was pleased
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: So many compartments, Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has so many compartments so much stuff can fit in it. I love how snug the camera/lense compartment is, it keeps everything in place. I put my flash pieces in the top part, which as a pleasant surprise had a "rain coat" for the backpack included. There is a special pouch for memory cards and a small pouch to keep the batteries. I love that I don't have to pull everything out of the bag to fish out a new battery. There is plenty of padding and the material seems to be of good quality. The little things that really excite you as an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Tfroggy

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke within a month
customer_reviews.text: It's a great backpack and plenty of space for what I need it for but the zipper broke already and I haven't even had it for a month. Pretty disappointed in that, otherwise good backpack. Update: I've had a chance to really put this backpack to the test for almost a year now. I would never buy this again. Initially it is good but all the zippers are terrible, the separators are terrible as they become flimsy after a bit and lenses are left flying all over the place. The bottom tore pretty quick. I'm retiring this and getting a better quality pack, you really do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son as he starts his concert/band photography business. He used for just a couple months, maybe 3 months, and the right strap tears out of the top of backpack. He has adapted the straps to make it a crossover bag now. Still giving 3 stars cause the padding is nice, the storage portion is great. Just wish the strap stitching to the bag was reinforced. Camera gear is heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Manentej

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. I had ordered a pelican hard case and although it is a great case, I needed something more lightweight and with quicker access, all in one place. I was able to get my Nikon with wide angle lens, 3 flashes and remotes, batteries and wires in the bottom section. The top is holding my spare Nikon with 24-55 lens and 2 flash covers. It is easy to grab and go for my real estate photography business. I was a little apprehensive with seeing a few reviews of the straps ripping but with all of the good reviews I took a chance and I am glad. It appears to be very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jerri Mccombs

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo Switch / Streaming Go-Bag
customer_reviews.text: I found this for the ultimate gaming/streaming "On the go Bag" Easy Access Im able to Play in Airports/waiting rooms/hotels/lobbys/conventions i can seriously challenge anyone to Mortal Kombat or SuperSmash in public without a outlet. this Bag makes EVERYTHING POSSIBLE! - Nintendo switch / Dock - 2 switch lites - usb.c monitor - 2 Powerbanks - 4 gamecube c' - 2 elite c' - 2 sony cameras/ 2 Lens - Microsoft surface 7 - joycons - cables/mounts above all slides on my Carry-on luggage that holds my consoles. BRAVO!!! *My Favorite Bag!*
customer_reviews.author: Sean H. Mccormick

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it for a trip that would involve a good amount of hiking. Arrived as promised. Very comfortable to wear. Highly adjustable with shoulder, chest and waist straps. Loved the side access to my camera so I didn't have to completely take it off to get my camera. plenty of pockets and storage areas. You are not loading up your entire arsenal of lenses in this, but enough space for four or five depending on size. After a week trekking around Arizona and four airplane flights, it seems to have worn well. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: TJO

customer_reviews.title: Not enough space small departments for camera lens
customer_reviews.text: The departments for camera and lens is really small. The camera is perfect but my larger lens dont fit even removing dividers. I have 300mm nikon and doesn't fit. The zipper on side doesn't work but not worried as it opens up to access camera quicker dont use it. My tripod fits in side after adjustment made but now bag will not stand up falls over. The tripod is light weight one. Overall bag nice but don't recommend if you have larger lens and need space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits everything nicely, sturdy and very light weight!
customer_reviews.text: There's was absolutely nothing I disliked about this product! It had so much more space than it showed. Almost the entire inside is easily adjustable and was able to fit my camera, lenses, flash, microphone, cleaning kit, lens filters and a few more accessories ; this was only the main compartment! Every other pocket seamed to be tailored for almost everything else. Other than great interchangeable storage; it is very sturdy and not to mention it is also very light weight!! Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: What Matthew Thinks

customer_reviews.title: Do Not buy this bag
customer_reviews.text: Do Not buy this bag, I am so disappointed in the overall quality!!!! Very cheap looking bag, materials are cheap, and the zippers are NOT metallic as it is described!! Plastic! Very poor quality!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: I love this pack as I get back into photography
customer_reviews.text: As I returned to photography in a more serious fashion I needed a larger portable bag for my new gear. This is a great choice with significant storage. Hold 1-2 camera bodies, 4-5 lens, a flash system, tripod, memory cards and more.
customer_reviews.author: G. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I think this case has some really nice features. However, whoever designed it could have done a better job. The main compartment dividers are not really big enough to reach from one to the next. There seems to be a fair amount of wasted space making it difficult to organize all my camera gear in this case. I ended up returning it for a case where the main compartment is the full length of the backpack. So it has one large main compartment. The new style I purchased worked much, much better for organization of my gear, and I can fit more in it too!
customer_reviews.author: Father

customer_reviews.title: Compares favorably to Lowe Pro Counterpart
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a well made alternative to the similar Lowe Pro item. The separate compartments seemed well thought out and the fit was comfortable. I ultimately determined that it wouldn't serve my particular need, but if you are looking at the small Lowe Pro AW - this is a very good and slightly less expensive alternative. Each has a different scheme for compartments, but essentially similar for the camera. I would recommend looking at it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Has All the Features I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack for my Nikon dSLR and gear. 'Baby bear' size -- not too small and not too big. It has all the features I wanted: plenty of pockets, tripod straps, side 'door' for easy camera access, laptop pocket (my ASUS 13" screen laptop fits perfectly), and rain cover. And it looks cool. Recommend checking out youtube videos on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Young

customer_reviews.title: The camera bag I'd been looking for
customer_reviews.text: The bag is comfortable to wear. The hip and chest straps secure the bag even more, useful when hiking. The bag has a slim form factor but fits a DSLR body with a 70-200mm lens attached and several other lenses and a flash. That's just in the lower padded compartment. The top compartment was perfect to stow my wallet, phone, phone charger, etc. My favorite feature is the side flap that enables you to pull out the camera while the bag is still on your shoulder, without opening the whole bag.
customer_reviews.author: RoamingChile

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Camera Backpack! I have two different cameras (Nikon and Canon) and this is my way of keeping them both organized. This backpack is perfect and has plenty of room. I have used my first one at least ten times traveling and it held up very well. My only gripe is the price went up $10 but I bought it because I really wanted it again. If you are looking for a good camera backpack to cary and store your lens and camera, I highly recommend this one. It is not to bulky and so far it is well built!
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, poor material
customer_reviews.text: I returned the bag because it came with a broken zipper, but it happens. The reason why I don’t give the fifth star is because the zippers aren’t very high quality. They don’t slide smoothly and maybe if I kept it longer I would see how these zippers last. I got a different bag at a similar price and saw a big difference in material and zipper quality. I would say zippers don’t matter too much, but if your bag doesn’t close because it’s missing a zipper, what do you do?
customer_reviews.author: Brennen D.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Value!
customer_reviews.text: The backpack met all of my expectations. It provided protection for my Cannon DSLR camera, extra lens and my laptop! I used it for the first time on a trip to Ireland. I found it to be very study and light weight. I was able to pack the battery charger and extra batteries for my camera and the charger for the laptop. With all of the gear in it I had extra room around my feet for the flight! It met all of my expectations! highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Larry C Strong

customer_reviews.title: Son approved 👍
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my son. He wanted a backpack camera bag. He loaded up the backpack as soon as he could! All his gear fits in there! I have received multiple “Thanks Dad!!” I’m happy and I feel my money was well spent.
customer_reviews.author: T W

customer_reviews.title: Holds a surprising amount of gear.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I have a Canon 6D with a Sigma wide angle lens, a Canon 7D with a Tamron 18-250 zoom, and an ultrawide angle lens in the main body compartment (with lenses attached), and a Canon L 100-400 lens in the top compartment ... with some room to spare there. Travel and other docs will fit easily into the thin rear compartment. There are two other, smaller compartments to play with for cards, lens tissue, etc. I haven't taken it out in the field yet, but so far it is pretty impressive.
customer_reviews.author: JK in NY

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good all in one camera bag
customer_reviews.text: I am shopping for a new bag now and realize I bought this one 4 years ago, it's been holding up very well, but I need more room, the bag fit my 5D Mark 3 with 2 additional lenses, Speedlight and, wireless trigger etc accessories and a tripod on the side. Really good deal, unfortunately the interior start breaking and I am afraid the protection structure is compromise...
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Overall this is a nice bag but I have to give a three star ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a nice bag but I have to give a three star rating because the first time using it the lower backpack strap buckle popped off and I couldn’t re-attach it. It was super frustrating as I just cleared TSA checkpoint and was on my way to vacation and I just bought it for my trip. Thankfuly I was able to rig it to clip to itself for the rest of my trip but honestly I hadn’t used it for more that 30 minutes. Buckles are poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Jac

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it even at this price
customer_reviews.text: Camera bag seems ok but already started on the wrong foot. Pay attention to the lower reviews. There are definitely quality issues with the bag, especially zippers. One of the zippers is missing completely. Obviously no quality control because if part of the process required just opening the pockets, it should have been obvious. Tripod pocket is pretty solid at least. And the primary storage area is roomy. The smaller pocket for accessories is rather small. Honestly I'd suggest just bumping up your budget to a better bag.
customer_reviews.author: Cris Py

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t brought it in the rain yet so don’t know how that holds up, but I’ve tried a few dozen camera bags over the past decade and this is by far my favorite. Hard cases are bulky and annoying for travel but I’ve used them for years because a lot of my photo excursions involve several miles of extremely rough off-road driving. This bag holds up very nicely and all of the little adjustable walls in the main pouch keep my lenses apart.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for the great design! I love it!
customer_reviews.text: When I got this pack my first impression was that it was actually designed by someone who is a photographer. The other cases I've owned left me wondering. I love the little pockets I can use for extra batteries and the little sd card holder is very accessible. The side door for taking the camera out is excellent. The straps are nice and wide and very comfortable. UPDATE: Sad to say a small tear appeared by the zipper. :(
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Holds all my gear that came with my camera bundle
customer_reviews.text: I needed a something that held all my gear that came with my camera bundle package. There is plenty of storage for extra lenses, filters, and bodies. The compartment at the to has plenty of storage space for cords, batteries, SD cards, and flash with a slave.I am very happy with the amount of space and the look of the backpack. I would purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Jarhead 1103

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for a couple of weeks now and I really like it! It has plenty of storage space, is well padded to protect my equipment and while I haven't taken it very far as a back pack it seems to be very comfortable and the adjustments are great. Quality appears to be fine too- I see no weaknesses. So yes, I would recommend this bag to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin K. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: After my current backpack had a strap go bad, I purchased this with some gift money. So far, it is a great replacement. It is a bit bigger than I had, but now I like that. It has great dividers, moveable, but they seem strong. I have my Canon DSLR and at Tamron 18-400 mm zoom lens inside the quick side pocket and it fits just fine. Other lenses and accessories have plenty of room. For travel this will become my carry-on with extras packed in. And, Amazon got it to me really quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier. I put all my camera stuff, my laptop and a few work files in it, strapped it to my back to feel how heavy it would be and surprisingly it isn't near as heavy as my Swiss Gear backpack. This backpack is comfortable on the back or slung over one shoulder and you can tuck all the security straps out of the way when they're not in use. Plus, it comes with a rain cover which is an added bonus; it folds in on itself and tucks away nicely inside the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tina M. Bynum

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack for the $
customer_reviews.text: I like the lower compartment for the camera and lenses and the side zipper for easily accessing the camera. The computer slot is very handy. The upper compartment has the zipper on the low side and I often have items falling out when I open it when it’s leaning backwards at all. I wish there were more storage organization to this compartment, that would prevent items from falling out. Otherwise it gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I went on ta road trip this summer where I would be doing some hiking. I have a full-sized backpack that I usually use to carry my primary camera kit, but it is HUGE. Since I damaged my knee and was still going to hike, I needed something smaller. This fit the bill. I do which that it was maybe half an inch larger on each side since my stuff is literally crammed into it, but it is lighter, smaller and best of all, the straps are actually more adjustable than on my full-sized pack. That was good. I'm glad that I purchased this for my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Gynzer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and executed product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, very well thought out functional design, and visually appealing. This is an amazing upgrade over my current camera bag which is a large over the shoulder carry bag. My favorite feature is the side access for removing the camera without having to open the large front panel and expose all of my extra lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Achilles

customer_reviews.title: So far, I love my new camera bag!
customer_reviews.text: My first camera bag I bought looked like a purse, but it was heavy and didn't hold much at all. Having a bad back, I thought it would be easier for me to carry a backpack type bag and it's helped a lot. I was surprised at how much the bag actually holds and I love that I'm able to take my camera out from the front, or the side of the bag. I haven't been out with it yet thought, so I'll come back and edit my review when I've actually gotten out and used it, carried it around and put it to test.
customer_reviews.author: Dionne Y

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY FOR PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a surprise gift because he is a photographer and was always using a very thin backpack and I was afraid that he was gonna damage his equipment. It is perfect for him all the different compartments work out great we can carry the MacBook, his 2 cameras, 6 lens in the bag. He also puts his additional battery and SD card in the bag. He still has space for more!
customer_reviews.author: Charisma

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING. Super high quality and IM IN LOVE. 5 Star. Read my review
customer_reviews.text: INSANE HOW MUCH I LOVE GHIS BAG. Every pocket is perfect. It’s like the person who designed thing was an pro photographer who carried his Mac book just like me. I meam This holds my mac book, my iPad, my iPhone, all my cords, my Mark iii, my sigma art lens, my tri pod and it comes with a rain case too. Like seriously best backpack times a million. This is the 3rd bag i bought The 2 others we cheap and a joke. This bag I’d pay 150$ for
customer_reviews.author: IVIBED

customer_reviews.title: The Best Photo Bag Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smaller bag for my equipment, I have a lot of bags but this one had became my favorite. Lot of space or a Dslr or Mirrorless and lenses, well built, nice access to equipment, holds my 15" Macbook Pro, space for cards, cables and even protection for rain. On my bag currently is filled with a Lumix G85, GH4, 4-5 lenses, extra batteries, cables, ND filters, memory cards and 15' MBP or iPad (depending the occasion). This bag is the right size and have the right space for most of my equipment. I loaded it also with 2 Nikon FX DSLR's 4 lenses and a Speedlight unit.
customer_reviews.author: Nestmac

customer_reviews.title: Have tons of space and places for everything.
customer_reviews.text: I like this style of camera equipment bag for many reasons over a regular bag due to being able to grab and go, over and on the shoulders so my hands are free for snapping that great shot. The material this is made from is amazing and seems it will last a very long time. I was looking for a very durable bag and this definitely seems to fit the bill compared to my Gregory backpack. I’m very pleased with my selection and their build quality.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Ripping after 3 days of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my week long trip to Spain and after day 3, I realized the upper pouch was already ripping. After a couple more days, the seams on the straps are coming undone. This is definitely not a good quality backpack and don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Camera Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Love this USA Gear Camera Backpack. It's lightweight, very comfortable and holds more than enough gear. The Only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is that I can't comment on the durability of the unit. But, that's because I've only had it for a month. With that said, I am looking forward to trying out other products made by USA Gear. Definitely worth a try at its price point.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony L

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag, but began to fall apart after very minimal use.
customer_reviews.text: Really liked the idea of this backpack to start. But after my first extended trip to Scotland, I noticed that a corner seam was beginning to fray already. It's too late to return it now, so I'm stuck with it. Won't use this company again in the future, however. My advice....spend a few extra dollars for a more durable backpack.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my first trip with the backpack and it is off the hook! The backpack did great in the airport as well as on the plane. I like the way you can get to your camera from the zippered side of the bag in one quick motion. Plus it holds son much stuff. Right now in the bag I have a Nikon D7200 with a 18 -300 lens. My Sony 6000 with Lens and a 50 -200 lens also packed in the backpack. A bunch of batteries, filters,chargers and a small tripod and still have room.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Thompson

customer_reviews.title: 3 Stars at time of purchase, will update after use
customer_reviews.text: I gave 3 stars because the quality of the bag seems alright. The straps don't seem as sturdy as they could be. I also don't understand the warranty. I went to the "usegear.com/warranty" as the instructions say, but the site is apparently up for sale? There is no place to register the bag. It also says 3 year warranty, then somewhere in the small print says 2 year warranty and then later in the small print it says 1 year limited warranty. I'm going to be very upset if this rips during my first few uses. Will update accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Vrabel

customer_reviews.title: Good design, horrible execution and bad materials
customer_reviews.text: I hate giving bad reviews but I was really disappointed with this backpack. The shoulder straps are incredibly flimsy and uncomfortable so I just tuck them ina and carry it around from the top handle. The interior dividers are come if apart at the stitches. The reason it comes with a rain fly is because the walls are super thin. The design it self is good but the materials and fabrication is not. It looks good in pictures but in your hands and on the field it falls apart
customer_reviews.author: Hernan H. Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Cheep. Falls apart almost instantly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this bag. After only one week of use, it’s already splitting apart. When the bag arrived, and I first picked it up, I could tell that it was cheep! The material is worse than a 5 clearance Spider-Man backpack at dirt cheep. I’m not lying!!! How am I supposed to trust over a thousand dollars worth of camera equipment, with a bag that falls apart after only a week of use. Save your money and buy something else! And read the reviews first!
customer_reviews.author: Balor

customer_reviews.title: overall good camera case
customer_reviews.text: One of the points to review was water resistance. the material probably is (I wasn't going to actually try it, it does have several plastic zippers, so water can get in. Will probably be just fine for a light rain, but heavy rain, or leaving it out, will almost certainly leak. fit nice to carry, hope it is durable, for the long term.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Larum

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: So far this bag has been great! Its tricky if you want to fit 2 cameras plus lenses. I do wish for more storage space, but I can easily leave a lense behind if I don't think I'll need it. I love the color combo for sure. Padding is great, maybe could use more padding at the bottom? But it has the thick slip resistant bottom as well. So far, I'm loving it!
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: Fits my laptop, 2 DSLRs w/lens, extra lenses, tripod, shotgun mic, extra batteries/accessories...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice layout! The zippers and craftsmanship are excellent, cannot say anything negative about this bag (this replaced my laptop and camera bags). I can easily take everything with or leave some behind. Replaced my similar quality lowerpro camera bag and targus laptop bag. I ordered the black with red piping, which I didn't much care for, only because it was available same day and I needed it ASAP. If I could turn back time, I would have ordered an all black or black/grey combo.
customer_reviews.author: MilwaukeeTalkie

customer_reviews.title: Use caution in the rain
customer_reviews.text: I love having one bag to carry my camera, lenses, chargers and laptop. However, when I was using it to photograph an outdoor event in the rain for 6 hours, even with the rain cover on, the inside of the bag got damp. The rain cover wraps around the bag on all sides except where it lies against your back. Rain running down the back of my raincoat saturated into the bag. I had to leave it empty and air it out for a couple months before I was comfortable putting my equipment back in. Other than that, I highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Everything fits!
customer_reviews.text: I finally have the DSLR and accessories I’ve had my eye on for quite a while. I wanted a bag large enough for everything. Of course, it’s heavy when fully loaded. That is why I prefer a backpack style. This bag has plenty of options to configure the main compartment to the photographer’s needs. I have unused dividers. I haven’t had it long enough to comment on durability. I will edit my review, if there’s a durability issue.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J S

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable backpack!
customer_reviews.text: As a full time photographer, I use a lot of backpacks to carry my camera gear. I travel on location a lot and I have to have the backpack that fits my 15" computer as well. This backpack is durable, simplistic and comfortable. It is also very affordable. I wish the zippers were a little higher quality, but you get what you pay for. I like the tiny front pocket for memory sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina M.

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for camera and laptop
customer_reviews.text: Great camera backpack with lots of features and very customizable. It fits my 15” laptop just fine. I wasn’t very happy with how the camera body was loose in the slot provided so I added a small towel to take up the space. You can either carry a tripod or a water bottle, not both and the bottom can help with small accidental water incidents(like setting the backpack down in the ring of water left by a cold drink) but I would use the rain fly in the event of rain. I’m very happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: funkermudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Good size
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift. She liked it, and was able to fit all of her gifts in to carry home, lol. She's looking forward to packing up her camera equipment, which will fit well due to the large size of this back pack. Seems to be well sewn and made of heavy duty material. Feels like it will last years!
customer_reviews.author: relenta3

customer_reviews.title: Great bag and design but aged with a failure.
customer_reviews.text: It started out a great bag. Has plenty of room and does just what I needed. Unfortunately I want to retrieve the bag from my trunk today and BAM! The upper handle that you use to carry the bag with just came off. I'm guessing it was a manufacturing mistake and wont happened to everyone but still a major pain in the rear. I really like the bag had it not been for the handle malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: Dunham

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a beginner like myself
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner photographer who just got into the hobby but I like it. I don't have a lot of gear so it suits me well and I like the layout of the bag
customer_reviews.author: Charlie's Angel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Pro- holds every thing I need it to Holds my 15 inch laptop easily Has two supporting straps that clasp across yout front Distributes weight well Easy to organize Cons - The small front and side pocket are useless. Can't fit anything in them Small amount of wasted space in the quick camera access pocket
customer_reviews.author: Lenzie Crawford

customer_reviews.title: USA GEAR SLR Camera Backpack Case (Black)
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. It carries all my camera gear and then some. I have not used it in wet weather but am sure it will hold up. I take it to Florida on my trips from New York using the backpack part. It makes it one less thing I have to pack it is alway ready to go. I can not say enough good things about this case.
customer_reviews.author: teach408632

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE Straps ripped.
customer_reviews.text: So many useful pockets. Fits my 70-200 2.8 while being attached to the camera. Fits a very nice tripod on the side. Would definitely recommend. Build quality is very nice too. UPDATE: I did love this bag, fit everything exactly how I wanted it. The straps are ripping at the top though and I haven't done anything crazy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha G.

customer_reviews.title: The best backpack ever
customer_reviews.text: The best backpack ever for the price, the size and capacity. The load capacity was a little bit less than what I need, so I had to improve it taking the bag to a local backpacks manufacturer that helping me getting the back straps stronger and resistant. However is not backpack’s fault, it’s me overloading the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Arguello

customer_reviews.title: Its the perfect size to carry one camera body and a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: Its the perfect size to carry one camera body and a couple of lenses plus filters and batteries. The pack is light weight but sturdy. Love this pack for the city or for hikes in which I only want to carry a few lenses. The top has a small section where I can carry food/snacks, and I can utilize the laptop pocket to carry my water blatter. Would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: No regrets!
customer_reviews.text: I have never really been into photography, but I had jumpstarted my interest and wanted a bag that holds a small tripod. Got this one and am very satisfied! I've never gotten a complement on anything, but I got a few with this bag! Holds everything as snug or loose as you want, holds a small tripod, great back pocket for a small laptop or tablet. Fits what I needed and then some!
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, it carries 4 Olympus OMD cameras with a range of objectives, tripod, various clamps, chargers and odds and ends. I especially like the top pocket as it allows quick access to the most used camera - and it was this feature that determined by purchase. Many pockets. The large slot carries a laptop, two reflector sheets, and a sheet of perspex. All of my useful and essential gear fits - but only just. For the next model, include a bag at the base.
customer_reviews.author: djpmapfer

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack well made.
customer_reviews.text: I only find one thing I don't like. The straps would be much better if they could be removed. The lower strap that would be used during serious hiking is useless and cumbersome at any other time. For people that don't hike being able to remove these straps would be great. Other that that it's an exceptional backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dinwiddie

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This bag looks average but stores great! I was able to fit everything I own for my camera inside of here with extra room to grow into! I'm new to photography and didn't want to spend hundreds on a bag; however, my over the shoulder bag was too small and a hassle to travel around with. This bag solves both problems. I can throw it on my back and not worry about it and I can fit all of my gear (even my tripod!) Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good versatile camera bag.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for vacation. Camera, regular and telephoto lens, extra batteries, chargers, misc items below. Top had room for personal items as we used it as one of our carry-on items on the plane. Could fit under seat if needed, but we stored it in overhead storage. Worked well as a camera backpack on our vacation...would definitely recommend to others. Seems to be well made and versatile for many camera and accessory combinations. As others have mentioned, they is no way to lock zippers, only con I have on this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Louie

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: The order was prompt & I received it in plenty of time for Christmas. I gave it to my granddaughter & she loves it. She is16 & getting serious about her camera work so this was a perfect present. It was in the medium price range & I think it will be an asset for her for a long while. She might want something better if she goes professional & is doing landscape or animal photography in rugged terrains. But, she's not working for National Geographic yet! We'll see if her interest still holds through college. Overall, a terrific product, made well & durable.
customer_reviews.author: Danna Gara

customer_reviews.title: Returned because defective
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the backpack. The interior cloth was torn away from the Velcro used to separate the two large top and bottom compartments inside the bag. Please do not ship UPS.
customer_reviews.author: Manbuyingstuff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a "Personal Item" for traveling to Europe
customer_reviews.text: Got this to act as my Personal Item while traveling Europe. Let me bring my laptop, A7II, 2 extra lenses, battery banks, ear buds, Switch, and more. Build quality is pretty awesome, and smart usage of space it superb. While its a little big fro my day to day shooting, it's now my primary bag for trips.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Bidwell

customer_reviews.title: Lots of spots to put all kinds of things.
customer_reviews.text: Biggest negative I wish I knew before purchasing: the additional straps are not easily removed /added. I'm rarely going to take this hiking, so for me there's just a bunch of straps hanging off which looks tacky. Even if I cut them off there'd be the side wings on the bottom. I noticed a fee flaws right away, but overall decent quality. I really like the setup! It's lightweight which is great! Overall I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jesse coble

customer_reviews.title: Love this pack...
customer_reviews.text: I carry multiple small cameras for my production work...between those, mics, tripods, lights, etc... I needed something to consolidate my equipment into one bag. This is the perfect accessory for that. Light, but feels durable. I haven't needed it for rain yet, but I'm sure that it will work aces for me.
customer_reviews.author: Liranty

customer_reviews.title: Interior Dividers Leave Much to be Desired
customer_reviews.text: Good size and construction. Interior dividers are very flexible and do not support the camera equipment adequately in my opinion. They need a stiff liner with the padding over that. They are just material. The arrangement of the interior dividers is very limited.
customer_reviews.author: MDM

customer_reviews.title: There must be better ones.
customer_reviews.text: Has lots of room. My only complain is the compartments are really separated. If you put something in the top it can fall to the bottom. You camera is not seperated from the inside compartments so it kinda moves around and isn't as secure as I would like it to be for such an expensive peice of equipment. For the money I spent on this I am a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Mo&Boog

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT NOW
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS BAG! so many pockets for gear, cords, chargers, etc. The main thing I'd ask to be improved is the pocket that holds the tripod.... it's the one BAD thing on this bag! Please make the pocket deeper/longer to support a heavier duty tripod!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Vanner

customer_reviews.title: Like so far
customer_reviews.text: So far I like the backpack. It's got room for my 70 - 300mm 4/3 telephoto, 60mm micro 4/3 macro lens, the 14-42mm kit lens, my extension tubes, and a few wide angle lens attachments and still has plenty of room in camera storage area. All the rest of the compatments have a decent amount of room. I've not been out with it yet, so it's untested, but do see that if (that's the word) you register it within 30 days, then you get a 3 year warranty. You,ll have to work with the straps a bit, especially if you want to carry a heavier tripod. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Turner

customer_reviews.title: Comfy with lots of storage
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. I'm able to fit my 2 cameras canon 6D & 6T with battery packs....about 5 lenses & chargers a great lil pocket for memory card. Also my laptop. Great cushion but gets heavy carrying that much stuff around. Doesn't slip, plenty of belts to secure on your body for a snug fit
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Good looking Bag
customer_reviews.text: Husband bought this bag for me for christmas. The bag itself looks great! one thing i wish it had more of is a little more padding on the inside to help protect lens and camera. but overall my review for this bag is 4 stars! i will update as i start to use this bag with any issues i may have.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia S

customer_reviews.title: best gear for all my gear
customer_reviews.text: this product is absolutely amazing. i can fit all my gear in this bag. i recently starting vlogging and my regular camera bag just want logical anymore in the sense that all the carry-ons weren't so much as a carry on anymore and more of a hassle. trying to fit everything in on bag. from my computer to my drone to my D-SLR to my go-pro. now i have a piece of mind know that i have everything in one bag and not worrying about everything being crammed in one bag. and on top of that it even water resistant. and i have a bag that goes over it. over all, awesome product, super happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Abel Arbelo

customer_reviews.title: Great camera bag! Camera only.
customer_reviews.text: Is working but the buckle snapped. The straps seem too sketchy when i carry both my camera gear and laptop. I do not carry it on my back when i have both but when i just carry my camera i do carry it on my back. If my gear costs $2000.00 I cannot take the risk. Was hoping for a more heavy duty carrying case. Works for adventurous photography but don’t bring your laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my better half for all her camera gear. She absolutely loves it, since it has room for her essential gear that she takes for bird shoots. Water bottle holder, tripod, etc. she can even leave her 300 mm lenses on and it fits perfect. This is a honest review, as I was Not compensated for this!
customer_reviews.author: gb

customer_reviews.title: Great design and fits more than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: Here is what I have in mine: A large camera 4 lenses Shotgun mic Audio recorder 5 camera batteries w/ charger Varies cords and filters Large sun hood Laptop w/ charger Headphones ...and I still have a little extra room.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a real upgrade from my last $20 backpack. Construction is much better and the storage design is far superior. There are lost of little cubbyholes that are perfect for storing extra batteries and memory cards. I would highly recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: gunnnut

product_meta.title: USA GEAR DSLR Camera Backpack Case (Black) - 15.6 inch Laptop Compartment, Padded Custom Dividers, Tripod Holder, Rain Cover, Long-Lasting Durability and Storage Pockets - Compatible with Many DSLRs
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackMore features than you'll know what to do with!

Travel-Ready Construction
Heavy-duty buckles , handles and zippers make for long lasting use in any condition. The durable high-quality nylon and fabric construction is reinforced with thick padding to always protects your device. Padded shoulder straps and back also provide comfort and allow air to flow.

Custom Compartment Configuration
Large front zipper opening provides access to your camera, lenses and more. Velcro divider walls lets you customize the camera compartment and accommodate your equipment however you prefer. Two quick-access side doors allow you to grab your camera and lenses quickly, so you don't miss a shot.

Wear as a Backpack or Sling
Tuck-away shoulder straps allow you to wear the bag on one or both shoulders! You can also wear across your chest as a sling. Stow away unnecessary straps into the luggage handle slot. Waist strap included for weight management and comfort.

Additional Features
-Padded compartment (16.5"L x 10.5"W) for up to 15.6" laptops
-Large upper padded compartment for carrying bigger gear and accessories
-5 net accessory pockets for memory cards, cables, chargers, lights and much more!
-Tripod holding system with strap and foot holder
-Custom fit rain cover for unexpected storms and splashes
-Luggage handle slot for easy transportation on top of rolling bags and cases.

Works With:

Nikon / Canon / Panasonic / Sony / Olympus / Pentax / Fujifilm and more...
feature_bullets: BEST VALUE CAMERA BACKPACK with features normally found only on more expensive camera packs. Tons of customizable storage space, top compartment to fit your phone, charger and many other accessories
THE PERFECT AMOUNT OF SPACE FOR YOUR CAMERA GEAR – Ditch the boxy, bulky packs. The S17 offers plenty of room for the serious photographer as well as the enthusiast without an oversized form factor
COMPLETELY CUSTOMIZABLE INTERIOR – Padded dividers can be added/removed/organized based on your needs. Zippered side door provides quick access to your camera. Internal Dimensions of 11" x 10.5" x 6"
PADDED LAPTOP COMPARTMENT – We know you love your laptop as much as your camera equipment, so the S17’s laptop compartment features protective padding and fits up to a 15.6" laptop
METAL ZIPPERS AND SOFT RUBBER PULLERS – Reinforced zippers with non-slip soft rubber pullers, quickly access your gear without fearing zipper breakage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,115 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
